snippet: At least two dozen Afghan civilians, possibly many more, died in violence on Wednesday.
abstract: Violence takes the lives of at least two dozen Afghan civilians and possibly many more on June 6, making it the deadliest day for Afghan civilians so far this year; day includes a complex suicide attack in Kandahar City, killing 23, and a NATO airstrike that Afghan officials and residents say killed women and children in eastern Afghanistan.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and TAIMOOR SHAH
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kabul, and employees of The New York Times from Mazar-i-Sharif and Khost.

lead_paragraph: At least two dozen Afghan civilians, possibly many more, died in violence on Wednesday.

headline.seo: At Least 24 Afghan Civilians Killed in Violence
headline.main: Afghanistan Faces Deadliest Day for Civilians This Year in Multiple Attacks
headline.print_headline: Afghanistan Faces Deadliest Day for Civilians This Year in Multiple Attacks
